title: How Freaked Out Should We Be About Ukraine's Nuclear Plant?
description: The world has been warily watching the Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant in Ukraine. The nuclear complex is being held by Russian forces, while the plant itself is being run by an increasingly ragged and exhausted Ukrainian workforce. Shells have fallen on the complex, and external power sources have been repeatedly knocked out, endangering the system that cools the nuclear reactors and raising the specter of a meltdown. NPR's Kat Lonsdorf reports from inside Ukraine.

itunes:title: How Freaked Out Should We Be About Ukraine's Nuclear Plant?
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: Things have gotten increasingly dicey at Ukraine's largest nuclear plant, raising the specter of an accident or even a meltdown. What are the risks for Ukraine, and the world?
itunes:subtitle: Things have gotten increasingly dicey at Ukraine's largest nuclear plant, raising the specter of an accident or even a meltdown. What are the risks for Ukraine, and the world?
